title: Constify `std::net::IpAddr`, `Ipv4Addr`, and `Ipv6Addr`

labels.name: T-libs-api
labels.description: Relevant to the library API team, which will review and decide on the PR/issue.

labels.name: A-const-fn
labels.description: Area: const fn foo(..) {..}. Pure functions which can be applied at compile time.

labels.name: C-feature-request
labels.description: Category: A feature request, i.e: not implemented / a PR.

body:
Due to recent stabilizations of const integer arithmetic and const control flow, all methods of types `std::net::IpAddr`, `Ipv4Addr`, and `Ipv6Addr` can be made const. This issue provides an overview of all methods and steps that need to be taken:

# `Ipv4Addr`

Methods already stable const:

- `new`
- `is_unspecified`

Methods unstable const by [PR#76142](https://github.com/rust-lang/rust/pull/76142) (`const_ipv4`):

- `octets`
- `is_loopback`
- `is_private`
- `is_link_local`
- `is_shared` (unstable)
- `is_ietf_protocol_assignment` (unstable)
- `is_benchmarking` (unstable)
- `is_multicast`
- `is_documentation`
- `is_global` (unstable)
- `is_reserved` (unstable)
- `is_broadcast`
- `to_ipv6_compatible` ([deprecated](https://github.com/rust-lang/rust/pull/75150)?)
- `to_ipv6_mapped`

None of these methods depends on an unstable feature, and could all thus be made stable const.

# `Ipv6Addr`

Methods already stable const:

- `new` (uses `#[allow_internal_unstable(const_fn_transmute)]`)
- `octets`

`Ipv6Addr::segments` has been made unstable const in [PR#76206](https://github.com/rust-lang/rust/pull/76206) (`const_ipv6`), together with all dependent methods:

- `segments`
- `is_unspecified`
- `is_loopback`
- `is_global` (unstable)
- `is_unique_local` (unstable)
- `is_unicast_link_local_strict` (unstable)
- `is_documentation` (unstable)
- `multicast_scope` (unstable)
- `is_multicast`
- `to_ipv4_mapped` (unstable)
- `to_ipv4`

All of these methods depend on `segments`, and thus upon the unstable feature `const_fn_transmute`, however the transmute is only used for better code generation, the operations could be rewritten equivalently using stable const code.

# `IpAddr`

The following methods are stable const:
- `is_ip4`
- `is_ipv6`

Implemented in [PR#76226](https://github.com/rust-lang/rust/pull/76226).

With the relevant methods of `Ipv4Addr` and `Ipv6Addr` made const, the following were also made unstable const in [PR#76304](https://github.com/rust-lang/rust/pull/76304):

- `is_documentation` (unstable)
- `is_global` (unstable)
- `is_loopback`
- `is_multicast`
- `is_unspecified`
